security: This document contains personal information about Manuel Marti, including his date and place of birth, and his address. Revealing this information could compromise Marti's privacy and potentially put him at risk. Additionally, the document details the methods used to conduct neighborhood checks, which could be exploited to circumvent future investigations.
summary: An agent report summarizing a neighborhood check conducted on Manuel Marti in the Bronx, New York, in October 1968, yielding little information from residents about Marti, who resided there from 1946 to 1965.
summary_one_paragraph: This agent report, dated November 20, 1968, details a neighborhood check performed by Alphonso E. Marshall of the 108th MI Gp (I-SIB) on Manuel Marti, born on May 17, 1946, in San Juan, Puerto Rico. The investigation, conducted on October 24, 1968, involved contacting residents of the apartment building where Marti lived from 1946 to 1965, located at 905 East 167th Street, Bronx, New York. Residents Bonita Rodriguez, Simona Padron, and Celia Robateau were interviewed, but none had knowledge of Marti or his family, and could not suggest other knowledgeable neighbors; Alexander Castillo, interviewed in a separate report, was a competent source.
title: [RESTRICTED]
